findings.metric: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome
findings.interpretation: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination was associated with broader antigen display in tumors.

findings.metric: Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome
findings.interpretation: Vaccination expanded the MHC-I-presented peptide landscape versus control.
The vaccinated subgroup showed a statistically improved survival association under ICI treatment.

findings.metric: Type I interferon response score (normalized units)
findings.interpretation: Type I interferon signaling was markedly induced after intratumoral mRNA vaccination.
PD-L1 levels in tumor tissue increased more than two-fold following mRNA vaccination.
CD8+ infiltration increased with combination-related conditions compared with baseline.

controls_or_null_results.statement: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.
ICI-only treatment had limited activity in low-immunogenic baseline settings.
Lipid particle controls lacking mRNA did not reproduce the sensitization effect.
Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated sensitization benefit.
